laboratory_examinations.findings: Red-cell distribution width of 18.1% (reference range, 11.5 to 14.5); otherwise normal. Peripheral-blood smear revealed 2+ anisocytosis and hypochromasia. White-cell differential count, erythrocyte sedimentation rate, coagulation tests, and liver function tests were normal.
2+ blood and trace protein by dipstick, 0 to 2 red cells and few bacteria per high-power field; otherwise normal. Urine pregnancy testing was negative.

Right atrial pressure 18 mm Hg (normal range 1-6), pulmonary-artery pressure 74/33 mm Hg (mean, 52; normal range 15-25/4-12), pulmonary-capillary wedge pressure 5 mm Hg (normal range 4-12), mixed venous oxygen saturation 32%, cardiac output 2.93 liters/min (normal range 4-6), pulmonary vascular resistance 1283 dyn·sec·cm−5 (normal range <240).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Diagnostic results indicated progresses to severe pulmonary hypertension, right atrial pressure was notably elevated indicating right ventricular failure.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Mild-to-moderate pericardial effusion and thickening of the left ventricular walls suggestive of concentric left ventricular hypertrophy. Left ventricular function was within normal range. Color Doppler showed mild tricuspid-valve regurgitation and a right ventricular systolic pressure estimate of 91 mm Hg.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Repeat echocardiogram post-treatment showed a normal pulmonary artery and right ventricle.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive at >1:5120 dilution, speckled nuclear pattern.
C3: 45 mg/dl (reference range 86–184), C4: 5 mg/dl (reference range 16–38).
